author: jsdelfino
msg: Removed imports that break the build.

author: psmith
msg: In an effort to get around LGPL issues, gutting the Web layer, and converting it
to provide basic JSON-style query services.  This will allow another module
built on top of this layer to be built using ExtJS, but done externally (probably
at my work at Aconex).  Should the LGPL issue ever get resolved (4 years and waiting I think),
it can be rolled back in here later.
Also added the beginnings of a high performance set of Appenders that are Pinpoint friendly.
The first one uses ActiveMQ as a JMS appender.  This will be easier to configure and install
than the JMSAppender for those that don't have much background in JMS, JNDI. A newer
AsyncAppender that is built using Java 5 concurrency principles will also be developed to wrap
Socket*Appenders to minimize ane performance problem of transmitting a smoking hot molten
stream of LoggingEvents (there can be a _lot_ in a busy server).
Left myself a note about Lucene's Normalization data usage.  Got bitten by that at Aconex, and nice
to learn from that.  If you don't use the normalization data, then you can save yourself a tonne
of heap memory by turning that off.
Some other general project tidy up, although elements of the project still look like my kitchen after
cooking dinner.

author: psmith
msg: Copying current state of affairs before a major rework to use JSON.
Just in case I delete something useful, I'll be able to find it later on.
